## Strategic Opportunity

- Build on existing Taiwan Studies Initiative and Taiwan Research Academy programs
- Taiwan MOE grant: $120,000 annually through NCHU partnership
- Establish UTD as North Texas hub for Mandarin education and Taiwan-U.S. exchange
- Zero new UTD funding required for initial phase

## Partnership Structure

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### UTD Provides

- Office space
- Administrative support
- U.S. visa sponsorship
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### NCHU Provides

- $120K annual funding
- MOE coordination
- Taiwan resources
:::
:::

## Official Structure

::: {.callout-note appearance="simple"}
### UTD-NCHU Liaison Office
\

**For the Promotion of Mandarin, Culture, and Research**

Supplements 2023 MOU 

- Integrates MOE resources, TECO Houston, partner institutions

:::

## Program Scope (Part 1)

- Non-credit Mandarin courses for UTD community and DFW residents
- TOCFL (Test of Chinese as Foreign Language) promotion and testing support
- Professional Mandarin curriculum development (e.g., Aviation)
- Teacher training workshops for K-12 and higher ed partners

## Program Scope (Part 2)

- Cultural events and Taiwan Studies conferences
- Collaborative research on Mandarin pedagogy and assessment
- Student recruitment for Taiwan scholarships and study tours
- Academic exchange programs and dual-degree pathways

## Budget Allocation ($120K Annual)

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
### Personnel: $60K

- Director (PT): $10K
- Research position (FT): $50K
:::

::: {.column width="50%"}
### Operations: $60K

- Programs: $50K
- Other expenses: $10K
:::
:::

## Staffing Model

- **Director (Part-Time):** Dr. Karl Ho, Director, UTD Taiwan Studies Initiative; oversees strategic direction and partnership management
- **Research position (Full-Time):** manages daily operations
- Additional teaching assistants and student workers as needed

## UTD Commitments

- Provide suitable office space and facilities
- Administrative coordination and quarterly progress reporting
- Visa support for international staff (if needed)
- Compliance with UTD policies and Texas regulations

## Timeline & Duration

- **Initial Agreement:** Effective upon signing through July 31, 2026
- **Renewal Option:** By mutual written consent, extendable annually
- **Reporting:** Quarterly progress reports, annual comprehensive review

## Strategic Impact

- Positions UTD as the North Texas gateway for Taiwan-U.S. educational exchange
- Expands international partnerships and diversifies funding sources
- Enhances student access to Mandarin learning and study-abroad opportunities
- Strengthens community engagement and regional language education ecosystem

## Next Steps

- UTD and NCHU review and endorsement of partnership agreement
- Finalize office space and administrative arrangements
- Execute agreement and initiate first funding disbursement
- Launch operations and begin program delivery (Spring 2026)
